medicines.name: Paracetamol
medicines.uses: Used to treat mild to moderate pain and to reduce fever. Common for headaches, muscle aches, arthritis, backache, toothaches, colds, and fevers.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 500-1000mg every 4-6 hours as needed. Maximum 4000mg in 24 hours. Children: Based on weight - 10-15mg/kg every 4-6 hours as needed.
medicines.sideEffects: Rare at therapeutic doses. May include: nausea, stomach pain, loss of appetite, itching, rash, dark urine, clay-colored stools, jaundice (yellowing of skin or eyes). Overdose can cause liver damage.
medicines.precautions: Do not exceed recommended dose. Avoid if allergic to acetaminophen. Consult doctor if you have liver disease. Avoid alcohol consumption. Not for use in children under 2 years without medical advice.
medicines.interactions: May interact with warfarin (increased risk of bleeding), isoniazid, certain seizure medications, and alcohol (increased risk of liver damage).
medicines.pregnancy: Category B - Generally considered safe during pregnancy when used as directed. Consult doctor before use.
medicines.storage: Store at room temperature (20-25Â°C) away from moisture and heat. Keep out of reach of children.

medicines.name: Amoxicillin
medicines.uses: Treatment of bacterial infections including: respiratory tract infections, ear infections, sinusitis, urinary tract infections, skin infections, and dental infections.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 250-500mg every 8 hours or 875mg every 12 hours. Children: Based on weight - 20-40mg/kg/day in divided doses every 8 hours. Complete full course even if symptoms improve.
medicines.sideEffects: Common: diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, rash, vaginal yeast infection. Serious (seek medical help): severe allergic reaction, severe diarrhea, yellowing eyes/skin, dark urine, unusual bleeding/bruising.
medicines.precautions: Do not use if allergic to penicillin. Inform doctor about kidney disease, mononucleosis, or history of diarrhea from antibiotics. May reduce effectiveness of birth control pills.
medicines.interactions: Probenecid (may increase amoxicillin levels), methotrexate, warfarin, oral contraceptives.
medicines.pregnancy: Category B - Generally considered safe during pregnancy. Consult doctor before use.
medicines.storage: Store tablets at room temperature. Store suspension in refrigerator after reconstitution. Discard unused suspension after 10 days.

medicines.name: Omeprazole
medicines.uses: Treatment of gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), stomach ulcers, duodenal ulcers, Zollinger-Ellison syndrome, and Helicobacter pylori infection (in combination with antibiotics).
medicines.dosage: GERD: 20mg once daily for 4-8 weeks. Ulcers: 20mg once daily for 4-8 weeks. H. pylori: 20mg twice daily with antibiotics for 7-14 days. Take before meals.
medicines.sideEffects: Common: headache, diarrhea, stomach pain, nausea, gas. Serious: severe diarrhea, bone fracture risk with long-term use, low magnesium levels, kidney problems, lupus.
medicines.precautions: Do not crush or chew capsules. May increase risk of bone fractures with long-term use. Inform doctor about liver disease. Not for immediate relief of heartburn.
medicines.interactions: Clopidogrel (reduced effectiveness), ketoconazole, itraconazole, iron supplements, digoxin, warfarin, diazepam, phenytoin.
medicines.pregnancy: Category C - Use only if clearly needed. Consult doctor before use during pregnancy.
medicines.storage: Store at room temperature away from moisture and heat. Keep in original container.

medicines.name: Salbutamol
medicines.uses: Relief and prevention of bronchospasm in asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), and exercise-induced bronchospasm.
medicines.dosage: Adults and children over 4 years: 1-2 inhalations every 4-6 hours as needed for symptoms. Maximum: 8 inhalations in 24 hours. For prevention: 2 inhalations 15-30 minutes before exercise.
medicines.sideEffects: Common: tremor, nervousness, headache, dizziness, throat irritation, cough, fast/pounding heartbeat. Serious: chest pain, irregular heartbeat, worsening breathing problems, allergic reactions.
medicines.precautions: Not for regular scheduled use - use only for symptom relief. Overuse can be dangerous. Inform doctor about heart problems, high blood pressure, diabetes, or thyroid disorders.
medicines.interactions: Beta-blockers (may reduce effectiveness), diuretics, digoxin, MAO inhibitors, tricyclic antidepressants.
medicines.pregnancy: Category C - Use if clearly needed. Consult doctor before use during pregnancy.
medicines.storage: Store at room temperature. Avoid extreme temperatures. Shake well before use. Prime inhaler if new or not used for 2 weeks.

medicines.name: Atorvastatin
medicines.uses: Lowering cholesterol and triglycerides in the blood to reduce risk of heart attack, stroke, and other heart complications in people with diabetes, coronary heart disease, or other risk factors.
medicines.dosage: Initial dose: 10-20mg once daily. Maintenance: 10-80mg once daily. Usually taken in the evening. Dose adjusted based on cholesterol levels and response.
medicines.sideEffects: Common: muscle pain, weakness, diarrhea, joint pain, memory problems. Serious: unexplained muscle pain/tenderness/weakness (especially with fever), liver problems (dark urine, yellowing eyes/skin), allergic reactions.
medicines.precautions: Avoid grapefruit juice. Regular liver function tests required. Inform doctor about liver disease, kidney disease, thyroid problems, or alcohol use. Not for use during pregnancy.
medicines.interactions: Cyclosporine, gemfibrozil, niacin, antibiotics, antifungal medications, HIV protease inhibitors, warfarin, digoxin, oral contraceptives.
medicines.pregnancy: Category X - Contraindicated during pregnancy. May cause fetal harm.
medicines.storage: Store at room temperature away from light and moisture.

medicines.name: Cetirizine
medicines.uses: Relief of allergy symptoms including hay fever (allergic rhinitis), hives (urticaria), itching, runny nose, sneezing, and watery eyes.
medicines.dosage: Adults and children 6 years and older: 5-10mg once daily. Children 2-5 years: 2.5mg once daily (syrup). Children under 2 years: consult doctor. May be taken with or without food.
medicines.sideEffects: Common: drowsiness, fatigue, dry mouth, headache, sore throat. Serious: fast/irregular heartbeat, difficulty urinating, severe drowsiness, allergic reactions.
medicines.precautions: May cause drowsiness - avoid driving or operating machinery until effects known. Avoid alcohol. Inform doctor about kidney disease, liver disease, or glaucoma.
medicines.interactions: CNS depressants (alcohol, sedatives, tranquilizers), theophylline (may decrease cetirizine clearance).
medicines.pregnancy: Category B - Use only if clearly needed. Consult doctor before use during pregnancy.
medicines.storage: Store at room temperature. Keep syrup bottle tightly closed.

medicines.name: Metformin
medicines.uses: Treatment of type 2 diabetes mellitus. May be used alone or with other diabetes medications. Also used for polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS).
medicines.dosage: Initial: 500mg once or twice daily with meals. Maintenance: 1500-2000mg daily in divided doses. Maximum: 2550mg daily. Extended-release: 500-2000mg once daily with evening meal.
medicines.sideEffects: Common: diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, stomach upset, gas, weakness, headache, metallic taste. Serious: lactic acidosis (rare but serious - symptoms include unusual muscle pain, trouble breathing, stomach discomfort, dizziness, slow/irregular heartbeat).
medicines.precautions: Risk of lactic acidosis increased with kidney problems, liver disease, heart failure, dehydration, alcohol use. Temporary discontinuation before surgery or contrast imaging. Monitor kidney function regularly.
medicines.interactions: Cimetidine, furosemide, nifedipine, cationic drugs, iodinated contrast agents, alcohol.
medicines.pregnancy: Category B - Generally considered safe during pregnancy for diabetes management. Consult doctor before use.
medicines.storage: Store at room temperature away from moisture and heat.

medicines.name: Losartan
medicines.uses: Treatment of high blood pressure (hypertension), diabetic nephropathy in type 2 diabetes, and to reduce stroke risk in patients with hypertension and left ventricular hypertrophy.
medicines.dosage: Hypertension: 50mg once daily. Maximum: 100mg daily. May be used with other antihypertensives. Diabetic nephropathy: 50-100mg once daily.
medicines.sideEffects: Common: dizziness, stuffy nose, back pain, diarrhea, cough, tiredness. Serious: fainting, irregular heartbeat, symptoms of high potassium (muscle weakness, slow/irregular heartbeat), kidney problems (change in amount of urine).
medicines.precautions: Do not use during pregnancy (2nd and 3rd trimesters). Inform doctor about kidney disease, liver disease, heart problems, or electrolyte imbalances. Avoid potassium supplements or salt substitutes unless directed.
medicines.interactions: Potassium-sparing diuretics, potassium supplements, NSAIDs, lithium, rifampin, fluconazole.
medicines.pregnancy: Category D (2nd and 3rd trimesters) - Can cause injury or death to unborn baby. Discontinue as soon as pregnancy detected.
medicines.storage: Store at room temperature away from light and moisture.

medicines.name: Diazepam
medicines.uses: Treatment of anxiety disorders, alcohol withdrawal symptoms, muscle spasms, seizures, insomnia, and as premedication before medical procedures.
medicines.dosage: Anxiety: 2-10mg 2-4 times daily. Muscle spasms: 2-10mg 3-4 times daily. Alcohol withdrawal: 10mg 3-4 times first 24 hours, then reduce. Elderly: lower doses recommended.
medicines.sideEffects: Common: drowsiness, dizziness, fatigue, muscle weakness, headache, dry mouth. Serious: confusion, depression, memory problems, addiction, respiratory depression, paradoxical reactions (agitation, aggression).
medicines.precautions: Risk of addiction and dependence. Avoid alcohol. Not for long-term use. Do not stop abruptly. Inform doctor about liver disease, kidney disease, glaucoma, depression, or substance abuse history.
medicines.interactions: CNS depressants (alcohol, opioids, other sedatives), cimetidine, ketoconazole, rifampin, phenytoin, digoxin.
medicines.pregnancy: Category D - May cause fetal harm. Avoid during pregnancy, especially first trimester.
medicines.storage: Store at room temperature away from light and moisture. Controlled substance - store securely.

medicines.name: Ciprofloxacin
medicines.uses: Treatment of bacterial infections including urinary tract infections, respiratory infections, skin infections, bone/joint infections, typhoid fever, and infectious diarrhea.
medicines.dosage: Usually 250-750mg every 12 hours. Duration depends on infection type and severity. Take with plenty of water. Avoid dairy products, calcium-fortified juices, or antacids 2 hours before or after dose.
medicines.sideEffects: Common: nausea, diarrhea, headache, dizziness, trouble sleeping. Serious: tendon rupture (especially Achilles), nerve damage, central nervous system effects, severe diarrhea, allergic reactions, heart rhythm changes.
medicines.precautions: Risk of tendonitis and tendon rupture increased in elderly, corticosteroid users, and kidney/heart/lung transplant recipients. May cause photosensitivity. Not for children under 18 except for specific indications.
medicines.interactions: Antacids, iron/zinc/calcium/magnesium supplements, theophylline, warfarin, NSAIDs, corticosteroids, probenecid.
medicines.pregnancy: Category C - Use only if potential benefit justifies potential risk. Not recommended during pregnancy.
medicines.storage: Store at room temperature away from light and moisture.

medicines.name: Pantoprazole
medicines.uses: Treatment of gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), erosive esophagitis, Zollinger-Ellison syndrome, and Helicobacter pylori eradication (in combination therapy).
medicines.dosage: GERD: 40mg once daily for up to 8 weeks. Maintenance: 40mg once daily. H. pylori: 40mg twice daily with antibiotics for 7-14 days. Take before meals.
medicines.sideEffects: Common: headache, diarrhea, nausea, stomach pain, gas, dizziness, joint pain. Serious: severe diarrhea, bone fracture risk, low magnesium levels, lupus, kidney problems, vitamin B12 deficiency with long-term use.
medicines.precautions: May increase risk of osteoporosis-related fractures with long-term high dose use. Monitor magnesium levels with prolonged use. Not for immediate relief of heartburn.
medicines.interactions: Warfarin (monitor INR), ketoconazole, itraconazole, iron supplements, methotrexate, HIV protease inhibitors.
medicines.pregnancy: Category B - Generally considered safe during pregnancy. Consult doctor before use.
medicines.storage: Store at room temperature away from moisture and heat.

medicines.name: Montelukast
medicines.uses: Prevention and long-term treatment of asthma, exercise-induced bronchoconstriction, and allergic rhinitis (hay fever).
medicines.dosage: Asthma and allergic rhinitis: Adults 15+ years: 10mg once daily in evening. Children 6-14 years: 5mg chewable tablet daily. Children 2-5 years: 4mg chewable tablet or granules daily.
medicines.sideEffects: Common: headache, stomach pain, heartburn, tiredness, fever, stuffy nose, cough, dizziness. Serious: behavior/mood changes (agitation, aggression, depression, suicidal thoughts), allergic reactions, muscle pain/weakness, numbness/tingling.
medicines.precautions: Not for treatment of acute asthma attacks. Monitor for neuropsychiatric events. Inform doctor about history of mental/mood disorders. Continue taking even if symptom-free.
medicines.interactions: Phenobarbital, rifampin, gemfibrozil, some anticonvulsants (may decrease montelukast levels).
medicines.pregnancy: Category B - Use only if clearly needed. Consult doctor before use during pregnancy.
medicines.storage: Store at room temperature in original package. Protect from moisture and light.

medicines.name: Ibuprofen
medicines.precautions: Take with food, avoid if allergic to NSAIDs
medicines.pregnancy: Category C - Avoid in third trimester

medicines.name: Aspirin
medicines.uses: Pain relief, fever, heart attack prevention
medicines.precautions: Avoid in children under 16, take with food

medicines.name: Levothyroxine
medicines.precautions: Take on empty stomach, monitor thyroid levels

medicines.name: Prednisone
medicines.sideEffects: Weight gain, mood changes, high blood sugar
medicines.precautions: Do not stop abruptly, monitor blood sugar

medicines.name: Warfarin
medicines.precautions: Regular INR monitoring, avoid vitamin K foods

medicines.name: Sertraline
medicines.precautions: Monitor for suicidal thoughts, taper when stopping

medicines.name: Fluoxetine
medicines.precautions: Monitor for suicidal thoughts in young adults

medicines.name: Gabapentin
medicines.uses: Neuropathic pain, seizures, restless leg syndrome

medicines.name: Clopidogrel
medicines.uses: Prevent blood clots, heart attack, stroke
medicines.precautions: Monitor for bleeding, avoid with active bleeding

medicines.name: Insulin
medicines.precautions: Monitor blood glucose, rotate injection sites

medicines.name: Pantoprazole
medicines.precautions: Long-term use may cause B12 deficiency

medicines.name: Doxycycline
medicines.precautions: Take with food, avoid sun exposure

medicines.name: Azithromycin
medicines.dosage: 500mg on day 1, then 250mg daily for 4 days

medicines.name: Ciprofloxacin
medicines.precautions: Avoid in children, may cause tendonitis

medicines.name: Oseltamivir
medicines.uses: Influenza A and B treatment and prophylaxis
medicines.precautions: Start within 48 hours of symptom onset

medicines.name: Morphine
medicines.precautions: Risk of addiction, monitor respiratory function

medicines.name: Venlafaxine
medicines.precautions: Monitor blood pressure, taper when stopping

medicines.name: Lamotrigine
medicines.precautions: Risk of serious rash, slow titration

medicines.name: Levetiracetam
medicines.precautions: Monitor for mood changes, suicidal thoughts

medicines.name: Topiramate
medicines.sideEffects: Cognitive impairment, weight loss, kidney stones

medicines.name: Metoprolol
medicines.precautions: Monitor heart rate and blood pressure

medicines.name: Carvedilol
medicines.precautions: Take with food, monitor liver function

medicines.name: Dexamethasone
medicines.precautions: Very potent, use lowest effective dose

medicines.name: Naproxen
medicines.precautions: Take with food, avoid in heart disease

medicines.name: Cyclobenzaprine
medicines.precautions: Short-term use only, avoid in elderly

medicines.name: Trimethoprim-Sulfamethoxazole
medicines.uses: Urinary tract infections, respiratory infections, Pneumocystis jirovecii pneumonia
medicines.dosage: 160/800mg (one double-strength) twice daily for most infections
medicines.pre1cautions: Avoid in sulfa allergy, adjust dose in renal impairment

medicines.name: Nitrofurantoin
medicines.precautions: Avoid in severe renal impairment, monitor for lung toxicity

medicines.name: Phenazopyridine
medicines.uses: Relief of urinary pain, burning from urinary tract infections
medicines.dosage: 200mg three times daily after meals for up to 2 days
medicines.sideEffects: Discoloration of urine (orange), headache, GI upset
medicines.precautions: Short-term use only, discontinue if skin/jaundice occur
medicines.interactions: May interfere with urine glucose tests

medicines.name: Methotrexate
medicines.dosage: Weekly dosing: 7.5-25mg once weekly for autoimmune disease
medicines.sideEffects: Nausea, mucositis, hepatotoxicity, bone marrow suppression
medicines.precautions: Contraindicated in pregnancy, monitor LFTs and blood counts

medicines.name: Sulfasalazine
medicines.precautions: Monitor blood counts and LFTs, avoid in sulfa allergy

medicines.name: Azathioprine
medicines.sideEffects: Bone marrow suppression, hepatotoxicity, increased infection risk
medicines.precautions: Monitor CBC and LFTs; avoid live vaccines

medicines.name: Mycophenolate mofetil
medicines.uses: Prevention of transplant rejection, autoimmune diseases
medicines.sideEffects: GI upset, leukopenia, increased infection risk
medicines.precautions: Teratogenic - avoid in pregnancy, monitor blood counts

medicines.name: Tacrolimus
medicines.precautions: Monitor drug levels, renal function, and electrolytes
medicines.storage: Refrigerate for injection, capsules at room temperature

medicines.name: Cyclosporine
medicines.uses: Transplant rejection prevention, certain autoimmune diseases
medicines.dosage: Dose varies by indication; monitor trough levels

medicines.name: Etanercept
medicines.precautions: Avoid in active infection, screen for TB

medicines.name: Infliximab
medicines.uses: Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis, rheumatoid arthritis
medicines.dosage: IV infusion dosing per weight and indication
medicines.precautions: Screen for TB and hepatitis B

medicines.name: Adalimumab
medicines.sideEffects: Injection site reactions, increased infection risk
medicines.precautions: Screen for TB, avoid live vaccines

medicines.name: Ustekinumab
medicines.dosage: Initial IV dose, then subcutaneous maintenance per label

medicines.name: Abatacept
medicines.dosage: IV infusion or weekly subcutaneous dosing per label

medicines.name: Rituximab
medicines.precautions: Screen for hepatitis B, monitor for infusion reactions

medicines.name: Denosumab
medicines.precautions: Correct hypocalcemia before use, monitor calcium

medicines.name: Alendronate
medicines.precautions: Take with water; remain upright 30 minutes

medicines.name: Risedronate
medicines.precautions: Take with water; remain upright 30 minutes

medicines.name: Calcium carbonate
medicines.dosage: 500-1000mg elemental calcium daily depending on needs
medicines.precautions: Separate from certain antibiotics and levothyroxine

medicines.name: Ferrous sulfate
medicines.dosage: 325mg (65mg elemental) one to three times daily
medicines.precautions: Take with vitamin C to improve absorption; avoid in hemochromatosis

medicines.name: Folic acid
medicines.uses: Prevention of neural tube defects, folate deficiency
medicines.precautions: Masking of B12 deficiency at high doses

medicines.name: Vitamin B12
medicines.dosage: Intramuscular injections typically 1000mcg weekly then monthly
medicines.sideEffects: Injection site pain, allergic reactions rare

medicines.name: Epoetin alfa
medicines.uses: Anemia of chronic kidney disease, chemotherapy-induced anemia
medicines.dosage: Dose individualized based on hemoglobin response
medicines.precautions: Monitor hemoglobin; risk of cardiovascular events

medicines.name: Filgrastim
medicines.dosage: Daily injections based on weight until neutrophil recovery

medicines.name: Omalizumab
medicines.uses: Severe allergic asthma, chronic idiopathic urticaria
medicines.dosage: Dosing based on IgE level and weight every 2-4 weeks
medicines.precautions: Observe patient after injection for anaphylaxis

medicines.name: Cyclophosphamide
medicines.sideEffects: Bone marrow suppression, hemorrhagic cystitis, alopecia
medicines.precautions: Hydration and Mesna may be used to reduce cystitis

medicines.name: Methadone
medicines.precautions: Monitor ECG, avoid with CYP interactions

medicines.name: Buprenorphine
medicines.dosage: Dose varies; maintenance dosing under supervision
medicines.precautions: Risk of dependence; avoid with benzodiazepines

medicines.name: Naloxone
medicines.dosage: 0.4-2mg IV/IM/SC repeated every 2-3 minutes as needed
medicines.sideEffects: Acute withdrawal symptoms in dependent patients

medicines.name: Naltrexone
medicines.precautions: Do not start until opioid-free; monitor LFTs
medicines.storage: Refrigerate for injection, tablets at room temperature

medicines.name: Loperamide
medicines.dosage: 4mg initial, then 2mg after each loose stool (max 8mg OTC, 16mg prescription)
medicines.precautions: Avoid in infectious diarrhea with fever or bloody stools

medicines.name: Orlistat
medicines.dosage: 120mg with each main meal containing fat
medicines.interactions: Cyclosporine, warfarin absorption may be affected

medicines.name: Saxagliptin
medicines.sideEffects: Upper respiratory infection, headache, pancreatitis rare

medicines.name: Linagliptin
medicines.precautions: No dose adjustment usually required for renal impairment

medicines.name: Dapagliflozin
medicines.precautions: Monitor renal function, risk of ketoacidosis

medicines.name: Canagliflozin
medicines.sideEffects: Genital infections, risk of amputation, dehydration

medicines.name: Prochlorperazine
medicines.dosage: 5-10mg three to four times daily for nausea
medicines.precautions: Risk of tardive dyskinesia with long-term use

medicines.name: Ondansetron
medicines.precautions: Use caution with other QT-prolonging drugs

medicines.name: Metoclopramide
medicines.dosage: 10mg up to four times daily before meals
medicines.precautions: Limit duration due to risk of tardive dyskinesia

medicines.name: Domperidone
medicines.sideEffects: Dry mouth, abdominal cramps, QT prolongation
medicines.precautions: Cardiac risk in some patients; check local approvals

medicines.name: Fexofenadine
medicines.precautions: Take with water; fruit juices may reduce absorption

medicines.name: Risperidone
medicines.uses: Schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, irritability in autism
medicines.sideEffects: Extrapyramidal symptoms, weight gain, metabolic changes
medicines.precautions: Monitor metabolic parameters, avoid abrupt withdrawal

medicines.name: Quetiapine
medicines.uses: Schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, adjunct for depression

medicines.name: Aripiprazole
medicines.uses: Schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, adjunct for depression

medicines.name: Haloperidol
medicines.dosage: 0.5-5mg two to three times daily depending on severity
medicines.interactions: Other QT prolonging drugs, CNS depressants

medicines.name: Ziprasidone
medicines.precautions: Take with food to improve absorption; monitor ECG
medicines.interactions: Other QT prolonging drugs, CYP3A4 inhibitors

medicines.name: Amiodarone
medicines.dosage: Loading then maintenance dosing per cardiology guidance
medicines.sideEffects: Pulmonary toxicity, thyroid dysfunction, liver toxicity, photosensitivity
medicines.precautions: Extensive monitoring required; many drug interactions
medicines.interactions: Warfarin, digoxin, statins, many CYP interactions

medicines.name: Sotalol
medicines.dosage: Dosing individualized; monitor ECG and renal function
medicines.precautions: Inpatient initiation often required for QT monitoring

medicines.name: Dabigatran
medicines.uses: Stroke prevention in non-valvular AF, treatment/prevention of DVT/PE
medicines.precautions: Renal dosing considerations; reversal agent available

medicines.name: Rivaroxaban
medicines.uses: Stroke prevention in AF, DVT/PE treatment and prophylaxis
medicines.precautions: Avoid in severe renal impairment; reversal available

medicines.name: Apixaban
medicines.uses: Stroke prevention in AF, DVT/PE treatment and prophylaxis
medicines.precautions: Dose adjust for renal impairment and age

medicines.name: Edoxaban
medicines.uses: Stroke prevention in AF, treatment of DVT/PE
medicines.precautions: Reduced efficacy in patients with high renal function

medicines.name: Nitroglycerin
medicines.dosage: 0.3-0.6mg sublingual every 5 minutes up to 3 doses
medicines.precautions: Avoid with PDE5 inhibitors, monitor blood pressure
medicines.storage: Store in original glass container at room temperature

medicines.name: Hydralazine
medicines.precautions: Monitor for lupus-like reactions with prolonged use

medicines.name: Hydroxyzine
medicines.precautions: Avoid in elderly due to sedation

medicines.name: Promethazine
medicines.sideEffects: Sedation, anticholinergic effects, respiratory depression in children
medicines.precautions: Avoid in children under 2 years, use caution with other sedatives

medicines.name: Ranitidine (Removed)
medicines.uses: Previously used for heartburn and ulcers (many formulations withdrawn in some regions)
medicines.precautions: Some products withdrawn due to impurities in some regions; follow local guidance

medicines.name: Dabigatran (Duplicate Note)
medicines.uses: Stroke prevention in non-valvular AF, treatment/prevention of DVT/PE
medicines.precautions: Renal dosing considerations; reversal agent available

medicines.name: Levofloxacin
medicines.precautions: Avoid in children unless necessary; monitor for tendon pain

medicines.name: Mupirocin
medicines.dosage: Apply to affected area 2-3 times daily

medicines.name: Benzonatate
medicines.precautions: Do not chew capsules; risk of choking

medicines.name: Bacitracin
medicines.uses: Minor skin infections, prevention of infection in minor cuts
medicines.dosage: Apply to affected area 1-3 times daily

medicines.name: Povidone-iodine
medicines.uses: Skin disinfection prior to surgery and minor wounds
medicines.precautions: Avoid prolonged use on large areas; iodine sensitivity

medicines.name: Bromhexine
medicines.uses: Thin bronchial secretions to relieve cough
medicines.precautions: Use with caution in peptic ulcer disease

medicines.name: Carbamide Peroxide
medicines.dosage: Instill 5-10 drops into ear twice daily for up to 4 days
medicines.precautions: Do not use with perforated eardrum

medicines.name: Sodium Fluoride
medicines.sideEffects: Nausea at high doses, dental fluorosis in children
medicines.precautions: Keep out of reach of children

medicines.name: Sildenafil
medicines.dosage: 25-100mg as needed 1 hour before sexual activity
medicines.precautions: Do not use with nitrates; monitor blood pressure

medicines.name: Finasteride
medicines.uses: Benign prostatic hyperplasia, male pattern baldness
medicines.dosage: 1mg for hair loss; 5mg for BPH once daily
medicines.precautions: Women of childbearing potential should avoid contact

medicines.name: Tamsulosin
medicines.dosage: 0.4-0.8mg once daily after the same meal

medicines.name: Oxymetazoline
medicines.dosage: 2-3 sprays per nostril every 10-12 hours (max twice daily)
medicines.sideEffects: Nasal irritation, rebound congestion with overuse
medicines.precautions: Do not use more than 3 days consecutively

medicines.name: Bimatoprost
medicines.uses: Open-angle glaucoma, ocular hypertension, eyelash growth (topical)
medicines.dosage: One drop in affected eye(s) once daily in evening
medicines.sideEffects: Eye redness, eyelash growth, iris pigmentation
medicines.precautions: Can darken iris and eyelid skin
medicines.storage: Refrigerate before opening; room temperature after

medicines.name: Travoprost
medicines.dosage: One drop in affected eye(s) once daily in evening
medicines.sideEffects: Eye redness, eyelash changes, eye irritation

medicines.name: Brimonidine
medicines.dosage: One drop in affected eye(s) 2-3 times daily
medicines.sideEffects: Dry mouth, ocular allergic reactions, drowsiness
medicines.precautions: Caution in patients with depression or cardiovascular disease

medicines.name: Acyclovir Topical
medicines.uses: Herpes labialis and topical herpes infections
medicines.dosage: Apply five times daily for 4 days

medicines.name: Clotrimazole Topical
medicines.uses: Dermatophyte and candida skin infections, vaginal candidiasis
medicines.dosage: Apply twice daily for 2 weeks (varies by indication)

medicines.name: Nystatin
medicines.precautions: Use as directed; not effective for systemic fungal infections

medicines.name: Ketoconazole Topical
medicines.dosage: Apply once or twice daily depending on product

medicines.name: Minoxidil
medicines.precautions: Avoid contact with eyes; discontinue if irritation occurs

medicines.name: Permethrin
medicines.dosage: Apply as directed; repeat in 7-10 days for lice

medicines.name: Ivermectin
medicines.dosage: 200mcg/kg single dose for many parasitic infections
medicines.precautions: CNS effects in rare cases; adjust dosing in hepatic impairment

medicines.name: Albendazole
medicines.dosage: 400mg once or twice daily depending on infection

medicines.name: Praziquantel
medicines.dosage: 20-60mg/kg as single or divided doses depending on indication
medicines.precautions: Use with caution in ocular cysticercosis

medicines.name: Rifampicin Topical
medicines.uses: Topical bacterial infections in select indications
medicines.precautions: Limited topical use; many systemic interactions

medicines.name: Phenylephrine (oral)
medicines.precautions: Avoid in severe hypertension or cardiovascular disease

medicines.name: Pseudoephedrine
medicines.precautions: Controlled in some regions; avoid in severe hypertension

medicines.name: Scopolamine
medicines.uses: Prevention of motion sickness and postoperative nausea
medicines.dosage: Apply one patch behind ear every 72 hours

medicines.name: Nicotine Replacement (patch)
medicines.precautions: Use as part of comprehensive program
medicines.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks

medicines.name: Varicella Vaccine (Live)
medicines.interactions: Avoid with other live vaccines concurrently

medicines.name: Influenza Vaccine (inactivated)
medicines.dosage: One dose annually; two doses for some children
medicines.precautions: History of severe egg allergy may need special handling
medicines.interactions: Antivirals may reduce effectiveness if given concurrently

medicines.name: Hepatitis B Vaccine
medicines.dosage: Series of 2-3 doses depending on product

medicines.name: Human Papillomavirus Vaccine
medicines.uses: Prevention of HPV-related disease and certain cancers
medicines.sideEffects: Injection site reaction, fainting in adolescents

medicines.name: Tetanus, Diphtheria, Pertussis Vaccine (Tdap)
medicines.uses: Booster immunization against tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis
medicines.dosage: One dose as recommended; boosters per schedule
medicines.precautions: History of severe allergic reaction to vaccine components

medicines.name: Rabies Vaccine (Human)
medicines.uses: Pre- and post-exposure prophylaxis for rabies
medicines.precautions: Follow public health guidance for exposures

medicines.name: Human Immunoglobulin (IVIG)
medicines.precautions: Monitor for renal dysfunction and thrombosis

medicines.name: Epinephrine Auto-Injector
medicines.precautions: Seek emergency medical care after use
medicines.storage: Store at room temperature; protect from light

medicines.name: Glucose Gel
medicines.dosage: Per product instructions; repeat as needed
medicines.sideEffects: Rare; may cause choking if given to unconscious patient
medicines.precautions: Do not give to unconscious patient orally

medicines.name: Glucagon
medicines.uses: Severe hypoglycemia when IV glucose not available
medicines.dosage: 1mg IM/SC in adults; 0.5mg in children under 20kg
medicines.precautions: Ensure patient has hepatic glycogen stores

medicines.name: Polymyxin B/Neomycin/Hydrocortisone Otic
medicines.dosage: Instill 3-4 drops into affected ear 3-4 times daily
medicines.precautions: Do not use if tympanic membrane perforated

medicines.name: Sodium Bicarbonate
medicines.precautions: Avoid in patients on sodium-restricted diets
medicines.interactions: May alter urine pH and drug excretion

medicines.name: Lactulose
medicines.dosage: 15-30mL daily for constipation; titrate in hepatic encephalopathy

medicines.name: Polyethylene Glycol 3350
medicines.precautions: Use with caution in renal disease

medicines.name: Senna
medicines.precautions: Avoid prolonged use to prevent dependence

medicines.name: Polysporin (topical)
medicines.uses: Prevention and treatment of minor skin infections
medicines.dosage: Apply to affected area 1-3 times daily

medicines.name: Tranexamic Acid
medicines.interactions: Hormonal contraceptives may increase thrombotic risk

medicines.name: Clarithromycin (Extended)
medicines.uses: Respiratory and skin infections, H. pylori regimens
medicines.sideEffects: Taste disturbance, GI upset, QT prolongation
medicines.precautions: Adjust dose for severe liver impairment
